name: Babylonian Mythology
tagline: The Enuma Elish and Mesopotamian Cosmos
description: Discover Babylonian myths of Marduk's cosmic battle, the Enuma Elish creation epic, and ancient Mesopotamian wisdom.
overview: Babylonian mythology inherited and transformed earlier Sumerian and Akkadian traditions, creating a sophisticated theological system centered on Marduk's supremacy. The Enuma Elish describes Marduk defeating the primordial chaos goddess Tiamat and creating the world from her body. Babylonian religion emphasized divination, astrology, ritual magic, temple cult, and maintaining cosmic order. The tradition influenced Jewish, Christian, and Islamic mythologies through the Babylonian Exile period.

culturalContext.primarySources: Enuma Elish, Epic of Gilgamesh, astronomical texts

sections.title: Marduk & the Enuma Elish
sections.body: Marduk, patron god of Babylon, defeated the chaos goddess Tiamat in cosmic battle. From her corpse he created heaven and earth, establishing divine order. This myth legitimized Babylonian political supremacy and Marduk's elevation above older Sumerian gods.
